messages.original:
At least two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacted the suburbs of Mykolaiv City.
Repeated launches from Crimea are reported.
At least two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacted the suburbs of Mykolaiv City.  Repeated launches from Crimea are reported.
A large fire is seen burning at the impact site.

Russian forces have captured the village of Komarivka, Hlukhiv direction, Sumy Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~116.
Total land area: ~1.22 km¬≤.
The fighting for Komarivka lasted approximately 18 days.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Konotop, Sumy Oblast.
Kh-59/69 cruise missile to Konotop, Sumy Oblast.
The missile disappeared east of Konotop. It was launched from a Su-57 in eastern Kursk Oblast.
Iskander from Feodosia, Crimea, to Odesa
Iskander from Feodosia, Crimea, to Odesa
Explosion in Odesa
Explosion in Odesa
It impacted in Chornomorsk, just south of Odesa
The impact took place in the area of the Chornomorsk Port. Smoke is seen rising.

Russian forces have captured the village of Prylipka, Bilyi Kolodyaz direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~100.
Total land area: ~0.32 km¬≤.
The fighting for Prylipka lasted approximately 40 days.

In the Komyshuvakha direction, Russian forces continued their offensive operations, making further significant progress in the direction of the Konka River.
Over the last 10 days, Russian forces have been advancing towards the village of Novoyakovlivka. They first improved their positions in the treelines southeast of Lukyanivske, and once that village fell, they were able to penetrate further northeast up a gulley, reaching Novoyakovlivka. From there, they were able to enter the western streets of the settlement, where fighting is now ongoing.
Once this spearhead had formed, efforts were quickly made to strengthen its flanks. Russian assault groups advanced east along the treelines on the tactical heights from the newly captured Lukyanivske, establishing control over new positions southwest and west of Novoyakovlivka. Infiltrations are now being carried out into the neighbouring village of Novoboikivske, as well as into the village of Pavlivka, to the south of Novoyakovlivka, after new positions were captured west of the settlement. 
+ ~7.97 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Current trends suggest that another large-scale missile and drone attack on Ukraine involving strategic bombers will take place in the next 1-4 days.
Currently I'm trying to determine some additional info about movements, so I will make a follow up post with more details when some things clear up.

Kharkiv City / surroundings is currently under attack from Tornado-S rockets. They seem to be impacting the Pisochyn area, just west of the city. This is where the TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant is.

In the Dobropillya direction, Russian forces continued to advance north of Pokrovsk, capturing new positions towards the rear of Rodynske.
After regaining the initiative once again and recapturing a number of previously lost areas, Russian forces continued pushing north from Pokrovsk. They were able to cross the road to Hryshyne at another point, capturing the second pig farm complex and securing positions in the adjacent treelines. From there, assault groups advanced further north, reaching the former "Zaporozhskaya" Mine from the south, which DRGs earlier infiltrated from Rodynske. 
As a result of these advances, the remaining Ukrainian formations in southwestern Rodynske withdrew to avoid being encircled, allowing the Russians to regain control over those streets and shift the fighting back to the northwestern part of the city. Russian forces also recaptured a number of positions along the highway between Rodynske and Pokrovsk, as well as the ruins of the pig farm complex there. 
+ ~7.80 km¬≤ in favour of Russia. 
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Kharkiv City / surroundings is currently under attack from Tornado-S rockets. They seem to be impacting the Pisochyn area, just west of the city. This is where the TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant is.
At least six strikes with Tornado-S rockets have been carried out on the TEC-6 Combined Heat and Power Plant in Kharkiv City so far.

Current trends suggest that another large-scale missile and drone attack on Ukraine involving strategic bombers will take place in the next 1-4 days.  Currently I'm trying to determine some additional info about movements, so I will make a follow up post with‚Ä¶

There are also reports that Russia is preparing to use an Oreshnik IRBM during the weekend. 
In my opinion, this is being mixed up with a potential threat for Iskander-I launches (Iskander-M with a 1,000 km range).

In the Druzhkivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance northeast of Sofiivka, capturing positions in the direction of a number of Ukrainian stronghold settlements.
After making progress northeast of Sofiivka, Russian forces continued to build on their success, advancing up four parallel treelines and entrenching along a perpendicular treeline further north. Additionally, Russian DRGs managed to cross the Poltavka River and enter the village of Novopavlivka.
+ ~0.92 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance towards Kostyantynivka, making significant progress in developing their offensive.
Following at least a week infiltrations, Russian forces managed to consolidate in the southern part of Illinka and in the forested gulley to the south. This allowed for DRGs to infiltrate even deeper, entering the low-rise residential parts of southwestern Kostyantynivka for the first time, and reaching areas further north in the direction of northwestern Kostyantynivka.
Additionally, Russian forces managed to clear out the rest of the pocket northeast of Yablunivka, where they captured a number of strongpoints in the forests there, and also improved their positions in the treelines in the direction of Berestok. This forced most of the remaining Ukrainian formations to withdraw from the forests north of the Kleban-Bykske reservoir, with those last positions now fully in the grey-zone. 
+ ~9.11 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Interactive map link: 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/1/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll

Military Situation In Ukraine On January 14, 2026 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On January 14, 2026 (Maps Update)
THE LIMAN END-RUN: BYPASSING DEFENSES, RUSSIA'S PENETRATION AIMS FOR SLAVYANSK'S FLANK

U.S. Could Attack Iran Within 24 Hours, Hezbollah Could Respond 
The United States military could attack Iran in the next 24 hours, Reuters reported on January 14 evening, citing two European officials.
An Israeli official also told the news agency that President Donald Trump had decided to intervene, though the scope and timing remained unclear.
Reports from earlier in the day revealed that the U.S. evacuated troops from multiple bases in the Middle East, including Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, as a precautionary measure. The Qatari government said in a statement that the evacuations ‚Äúare being undertaken in response to the current regional tensions.‚Äù
Later multiple U.S. military aerial tankers, at least six, were spotted taking off from Al Udeid Air Base to an undisclosed destination.
Read more 
HERE

From ‚ÄòSviati Hory‚Äô To City Outskirts: Russian Offensive On Ukraine's Northern Flank In Slaviansk¬†
In the Slaviansk sector, Russian "West" forces are intensifying their attacks on the northern approaches to the city. They are assaulting a major strongpoint near the Penkovyi Yar gully and expanding their control over the "Sviati Hory" park.
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, the Russian army is advancing in the Prymorske area. Units have advanced north of the settlement and consolidated their positions in western Lukianivka. In the Kupiansk sector, the situation remains complex within the city limits, where both sides are fighting for control of key buildings, including administrative structures.
In the Kharkiv sector, Russian assault groups are active in the Staritsa area and have advanced 450 meters in the forested area near Liman.
Read more 
HERE

'Prava Molod' And the Battle for Young Minds: Creating Ukraine's Ideological Cannon Fodder
Ukrainian youth organizations are involved in matters far beyond the realm of childhood. The Right Sector prepares its own reinforcements from a young age. Young people raised the right way justify the existence of the Kyiv regime.
The battle for minds in Ukraine is now in full swing. The authorities, their supposed opposition, and even common sense are all trying to pull the country's most valuable resource to their side. That resource is the younger generation. Young minds are not fully developed, making them more susceptible to outside influences than other social groups. They are more likely to become radicalized, act rashly, and perform incredible feats. What seeds are planted in their minds determines the outcome. Neo-Nazi groups in Ukraine are not averse to taking advantage of this.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russia Armed Brand New Geran-4 Jet-Powered Drone With Air-To-Air Missile (Photos)
The existence of an interceptor version of Russia‚Äôs latest Geran-4 jet-powered drone armed with an R-60M short-range air-to-air missile has been confirmed.
The presence of the Geran-4 itself was revealed very recently by Ukraine‚Äôs Main Intelligence Directorate, more known by its acronym GUR.
The Geran-4 was described as a deeply upgraded version of the Geran-3, which is alleged to be a copy of the Iranian Shahed-238 jet-powered drone. The drone maintains the overall delta-wing design, but with better aerodynamic and stealth features. It is also equipped with a more powerful jet engine ‚Äì allegedly a copy of the Chinese Telefly TF-TJ1600A-.
The drone could reportedly reach speeds between 350 and 500 kilometers per hour, and has an effective range of 850 kilometers.
üëâ

Assault Contracts: What Polymarket Predicts About the Capture of Ukrainian Cities in 2026
As of January of 2026, the Polymarket prediction market remains a key informal indicator of expectations regarding the development of the Russian army‚Äôs offensive. Its contracts focus on several hot spots, where traders place bets on the timing of the capture of specific cities. Trading is most active for key locations such as Kostyantynivka, where there is ongoing heavy urban fighting, and Orikhiv, to whose distant approaches Russian troops have successfully advanced.
However, the market clearly shows operational difficulties. A notable example is the situation near Kupyansk, where the Ukrainian Armed Forces launched a large-scale counteroffensive in late December, pushing Russian forces back from part of the right bank of the city. This event undoubtedly adjusted forecasts and timelines, making the capture of the entire city unlikely in the next month. 
üëâ
